subject: Education
title: Fixed vs. Growth Mindset: The Core Idea
description: One-minute skill: Fixed vs. Growth Mindset: The Core Idea.

hook.text: Tell a child 'you're so smart' and they'll avoid hard problems. Tell them 'you worked hard' and they won't.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck found that beliefs about intelligence shape behavior more than intelligence itself.

discovery.text: Fixed mindset: ability is innate. Growth mindset: ability develops through effort and strategy.

twist.text: Praising intelligence backfires because failure then feels like proof of permanent limitation.

climax.text: Growth-minded students embrace challenges; fixed-minded students avoid them to protect self-image.

punchline.text: What you believe about your brain changes how your brain works.

quiz.question: Why does praising intelligence backfire?
options: Failure then feels like proof of permanent limitation rather than a learning opportunity
Children become arrogant and stop studying
It only works for students over age 12
